page.title: 06FARMING AROUND LAUGHARNE
page.content: Farms, varying from 20-70 acres, rain- fall 35"-40", from sea-level to 500'. Of the 21 farms, 6 are Friesian dairy (3 are County Council Smallholdings), 15 beef with sheep and corn on some. All except Council farms are owner- occupied, none employ labour. Fields usually 3-12 acres, many less than 5. Some of Laugharne Corporation land, 167 acres at Hugdon (from Norman Knight, Hugh's Down) is owned by burgesses during their lifetime, grazed communally Nov/Jan and farmed in 1-3 acre strips by cropping for hay or silage during season. Milk collected daily by MMB tankers, sheep and calves taken by horse-box or similar to St Clears weekly mart, cows and store cattle by lorry to Carmarthen. Milk quotas/wet summer 1985 causing problems. Two local farmers do most of hay-baling.
